attributes.action: Stop the use of annual RPI increases in Mobile phone and Broadband contracts.
attributes.additional_details: This traps people into what looks like  good deal into something that gets a lot more expensive later while they are locked in.  Ii also fuels inflation.
attributes.background: Ban the practice of increasing contracts for things like mobile phones and broadband by the Retail Price Index plus a fixed amount where they increase automatically each year

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the terms and conditions of consumer contracts are a matter for individual businesses, not the UK Government or Parliament.

There is already legalisation to protect consumers from unfair terms in a contract, and it would be up to the courts to determine whether a particular term was unfair, and therefore unenforceable.

You can find out more about unfair terms in sales contracts here: https://www.gov.uk/unfair-terms-in-sales-contracts/unfair-consumer-contracts
